item.title: PS5 Accessory Sale - How To Save 20% On PlayStation Portal, Helldivers 2 DualSense Controller, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ps5-accessory-sale-how-to-save-20-on-playstation-portal-helldivers-2-dualsense-controller-and-more/1100-6529304/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PlayStation is hosting a pretty awesome limited-time sale for PS Plus subscribers on accessories. Subscribers who spend at least $100 on two or more PS5 accessories at PlayStation Direct will receive a 20% discount on their order. The promotion extends to all currently available products, including the brand-new Helldivers 2-themed DualSense Controller, Fortnite-themed DualSense Controller, and DualSense Edge. That means you could get the two newest Limited Edition DualSense Controllers for $68 each and the DualSense Edge for $160. The PlayStation Portal qualifies as an accessory, too, so you can buy the handheld for $160 when paired with another accessory.

The sale does not apply to preorders, such as the the upcoming Midnight Black Collection.

Get two Limited Edition DualSense Controllers for 20% off

Sale price is only available when purchasing two accessories that eclipse $100 total.

  • DualSense Wireless Controller - Helldivers 2 Limited Edition -- $68 ($85)
  • DualSense Wireless Controller - Fortnite Limited Edition -- $68 ($85)

Get a rare discount on the PlayStation Portal

Since the PlayStation Portal costs $200 by itself, you can get a good deal even if you don't want the other accessory. For instance, you could pair it with the $30 DualSense Charging Station. These two items would normally cost $230 in total, but your total drops to $184 thanks to the 20% discount. The cheapest eligible accessory is the PlayStation Link USB Adapter for $25. When paired with the Portal, you'll pay $180 total. Another way of looking at it: You're getting a discount on the PlayStation Portal and an accessory you may or may not want for free.

The PS Portal is a Remote Play handheld that resembles a DualSense Controller attached to an 8-inch 1080p LCD screen. It lets you stream games from your PS5 over Wi-Fi. It's a solid choice for anyone who wants to play their PS5 games from other rooms in their home, or while someone else is using the TV, or even while away from home. The PS Portal can be used anywhere; you don't need to be on the same Wi-Fi network. If you have an internet connection, you can wake your PS5 from rest mode and stream your PlayStation games while traveling.

A bunch more notable PS5 accessories that cost over $100 are also eligible for the deal, including the DualSense Edge Controller (normally $200), the Pulse Elite Wireless Headset (normally $150), and Pulse Explore Wireless Earbuds (normally $200). Combine one of those with an extra item like the $30 Vertical Stand for PS5 and PS5 Pro, and you'll get the 20% discount.

If you aren't interested in Helldivers or Fortnite, you can use the promotion to pick up a standard DualSense Controller in multiple color options. You can match your PS5 to your new controller by picking up alternate PS5 Slim Console Covers or PS5 Slim Digital Console Covers, the PS5 HD Camera, and more. Check the list below for all the PS5 accessories eligible for the 20% discount at PlayStation Direct.

Remember: to get the deal prices listed below, your order must include at least two eligible items from the items listed below that add up to $100 or more. The 20%-off applies to all eligible items in the order.

PlayStation Direct PS5 Accessory Deals

Spend $100 on two accessories to get 20% discounts shown below. The $100 threshold is based on the original prices of accessories.

  • PlayStation Portal -- $160 ($200)
  • DualSense Edge Wireless Controller (White) -- $160 ($200)
  • DualSense Wireless Controller - Helldivers 2 Limited Edition -- $68 ($85)
  • DualSense Wireless Controller - Fortnite Limited Edition -- $68 ($85)
  • DualSense Wireless Controller (multiple colors available) -- $60-$64 ($75-$80)
  • PlayStation Access Controller -- $72 ($90)
  • DualSense Charging Station -- $24 ($30)
  • PlayStation Link USB Adapter -- $20 ($25)
  • PS5 HD Camera -- $48 ($60)
  • PS5 Media Remote -- $24 ($30)
  • PS5 Slim Console Covers (multiple colors available) -- $44-$52 ($55-$65)
  • PS5 Slim Digital Console Covers (multiple colors available) -- $44-$48 ($55-$60)
  • Pulse Elite Wireless Headset -- $120 ($150)
  • Pulse Explore Wireless Earbuds -- $160 ($200)
  • Vertical Stand for PS5 and PS5 Pro -- $24 ($30)
  • Like A Dragon: Pirate Yakuza In Hawaii Collector's Edition In Stock At Amazon
  • Save On Sid Meier's Civilization 7 Preorders For PC & Mac - Early Access Starts February 6
  • Apple AirPods 4 Discounted To Only $100 At Amazon

  • Monster Hunter Wilds Preorders - Where To Get Steelbook Edition And Best Deals

item.title: GTA 6 Still On Track For Release In Fall 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gta-6-still-on-track-for-release-in-fall-2025/1100-6529307/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Rockstar's highly anticipated Grand Theft Auto VI remains on schedule to launch in Fall 2025, parent company Take-Two announced as part of its earnings briefing today. Some expected Rockstar to announce a delay given Rockstar's history of delaying its big games, but it did not happen.

In an interview with IGN, Take-Two boss Strauss Zelnick said there is "always a risk of slippage," but he feels "really good" about the game making it out on time in Fall 2025.

"Look, I think the game is eagerly anticipated both internally and externally," he said. "We know that Rockstar seeks perfection. I never claim success before it occurs. I'm fond of saying arrogance is the enemy of continued success, so we're all running scared and looking over our shoulders and we know that the competition is not asleep. Our whole organization is super excited."

Separately, Zelnick told Variety, "We've announced a pretty narrow window [for GTA 6]. So I think our view is that right now, that's fine. And then when itâ€™s appropriate, of course, Rockstar is going to have more to say."

Take-Two's share price is surging following the announcement of earnings, growing by more than 7%.

GTA VI has extremely big shoes to fill, as GTA V has now sold more than 210 million units, propelling the entire series to 440 million copies sold. One company believes GTA VI can sell 40 million units and drive $3 billion in revenue during its first year alone.

Rockstar's other juggernaut series, Red Dead Redemption, continues to soar as well. Red Dead Redemption II has now sold 70 million copies, up from 67 million just three months ago.

GTA VI is not the only big game that Take-Two has in the works for 2025, as the company is also launching Sid Meier's Civilization VII on February 11, PGA Tour 2K25 on February 28, and WWE 2K25 on March 14. Looking beyond that, Take-Two has Mafia: The Old Country lined up for Summer 2025, with GTA VI landing in Fall 2025, and Borderlands 4 at some point in calendar 2025.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Madden NFL 25 Hits Game Pass Today, And Now You Can Make Your Super Bowl Predictions
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/madden-nfl-25-hits-game-pass-today-and-now-you-can-make-your-super-bowl-predictions/1100-6529306/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Madden NFL 25 debuted last summer shortly before the start of the current NFL season, so it's fitting that it arrived on Game Pass today before the end of the post-season. That means Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass subscribers can run their own Super Bowl simulations before the Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles meet again on Sunday.

EA has traditionally released its Madden NFL Super Bowl predictions ahead of the game, but the publisher has yet to do so this year. Officially, Madden NFL's Super Bowl projections have only been right six out of the last 13 years, which gives it a 46% accuracy rating. Some years are closer than others, but Madden NFL successfully picked the exact score for Super Bowl 49 before the New England Patriots downed the Seattle Seahawks 28-24.

You may have noticed that the cover athlete for Madden NFL 25--Christian McCaffrey--doesn't play for either the Chiefs or the Eagles. Instead, McCaffrey is a running back for the San Francisco 49ers who spent some time on the injured list this year, reviving talk about the infamous Madden curse. The reality is that football is a physically taxing sport, and almost every player deals with injuries at some point. That hasn't stopped Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase from proclaiming that he's aware of the so-called curse, and doesn't want to be a Madden NFL cover star.

Madden NFL 26 will likely arrive this summer, but it has yet to receive an official announcement from EA. Although it's been 13 years since Madden appeared on a Nintendo console, EA is very optimistic about the franchise making a comeback on Switch 2.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Avowed Is Now Capable Of Running At 60FPS On Xbox Series X, Will Have "Jank" At Launch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/avowed-is-now-capable-of-running-at-60fps-on-xbox-series-x-will-have-jank-at-launch/1100-6529303/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Microsoft's next big game, the RPG Avowed from The Outer Worlds developer Obsidian, is capable of running at up to 60fps on Xbox Series X, game director Carrie Patel has confirmed.

Patel said on the MinnMax podcast, "You can get up to 60[fps]" on Xbox Series X. The use of "can" here might indicate an alternative graphics mode that prioritizes image quality over frame rate, but we don't know for sure as of yet.

The frame rate reaching 60fps on Series X is newsworthy in part because Obsidian previously said the game was only capable of reaching 30fps on Xbox Series X. Obsidian said this decision was made early on in the development of the game and has allowed the studio to get "a lot juicier" with visual effects. Things have changed since then, though, and Avowed can now run at a higher frame rate on Series X.

Patel also told fans to expect some amount of bugs and issues. "You gotta accept a little jank to do something fun and creative, I think," Patel said.

Avowed was previously set for release at the end of 2024 but was delayed to February for scheduling purposes, not due to quality. The game officially launches on February 18, but the $90 Premium edition unlocks five days early, beginning February 13.

Like Microsoft's other first-party games, Avowed is included with Game Pass Ultimate at launch. Members can buy an upgrade add-on to the Premium edition for $22.50 to get all the perks, including early access.

Avowed is Obsidian's first new release since 2022's Pentiment. It's not Obsidian's only in-development project, either, as the studio is also making The Outer Worlds 2, which is planned for release this year.

For more, be sure to check out GameSpot's Avowed preorder guide.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Apex Legends Season 24 Lets Livestreamers Run The Show
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/apex-legends-season-24-lets-livestreamers-run-the-show/1100-6529305/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A new gameplay trailer for Apex Legends' upcoming Season 24: Takeover has been released, and it features a major surprise: Respawn is kicking off Apex's sixth anniversary by letting content creators step into the shoes of the (fictional) Apex Games Commissioner, Kuben Blisk.

Four different "Content Commissioners" will take the stage from February 25 to April 28 (two weeks per content creator), introducing special challenges for players to overcome, exclusive cosmetic rewards, and fan-favorite limited-time modes for the duration of their two-week takeover.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Apex Legends: Takeover Gameplay Trailer

For the first week of each Content Commissioner takeover, players will "chase glory together to complete Community challenges and ultimately determine how many Apex Packs will be up for grabs the following week," according to a new blog post on the official Apex Legends website.

The community goals for the first week of each takeover are as follows:

  • Complete Tier 1 challenges: 10 Apex Packs earnable
  • Complete Tier 2 challenges: 15 Apex Packs earnable
  • Complete Tier 3 challenges: 20 Apex Packs earnable

The second week of each takeover is when players will get a chance to earn those Apex Packs. Players will be faced with five in-game challenges. Players who complete all five will gain access to the Apex Packs they unlocked during the previous week, along with a special Creator Commissioner-selected Legendary-tier weapon skin.

Players can also earn a free banner frame via Twitch Drops if they tune in to a Twitch stream from an approved Apex Legends content creator. A free Creator Commissioner-themed stat tracker will be available for players to gift to their friends via the in-game store.

The Apex Legends Season 24 Creator Commissioners schedule--and the Legendary-tier skins they've chosen for their two-week time in the spotlight--are listed below:

  • February 25 - March 10: Ninjayla (Legendary skin: Death Ray Wingman)
  • March 11 - 24: Oraxe (Legendary skin: The Pioneer Kraber)
  • April 1 - 14: Apryze (Legendary skin: Bone Breaker Mastiff)
  • April 15 - 28: Kaminari Qpi (Legendary skin: Tombstick Mastiff)

Respawn hasn't yet announced which limited-time modes will be available during the Creator Commissioner takeovers, though more information is likely to be shared when the Season 24 patch notes are released. The trailer did mention that both Ash and Ballistic were buffed, and details on those changes will also be available once patch notes are live.

The trailer also gave players a glimpse of the game's new Arsenals: special Loot Bins available in battle royale mode that include a weapon, ammo for that weapon, and a special attachment or hop-up for that weapon.

Apex Legends Season 24: Takeover begins on Tuesday, February 11 at 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
